result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CF552, 15CF985, 16CF244 called: 11:02am
State appears by ADA M.Puerner.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Abernethy Mays.  
 Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW - victim impact statement filed

State moves to :
15CF985>>D&RI entire file
15CF552 - Cts. 1, 2, and 5>>D&RI
16CF244 - Cts. 2-5>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
15CF552 - Ct. 3 (Battery/DA)>>NO CONTEST
15CF552 - Ct. 4 (DC/DA)>>NO CONTEST
16CF244 - Ct. 1 (Burglary/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty.
Defendant makes statement - requests not serving any jail time.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held on all counts; 16CF244 Ct. 1--5 years Probation; 15CF552 Cts. 3 and 4--3 years Probation; All sentences concurrent to each other.
CONDITIONS: 16CF244- Ct. 1 only>>180 days MCJ w/huber for work/treatment/education if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, w/credit for 94 days of time already served, to begin within 45 days at the discretion of PO.
CONDITIONS on ALL COUNTS: Completion of SAFE program intake and any counseling/follow up recommended; AODA; Absolute sobriety; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or any time he does not meet that requirement, defendant must complete 9 hours of C.S. per week; CC including 2 domestic abuse surcharges; DNA sample and surcharge; No contact with victim B.S. unless approved by PO.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): B.S.-NON WAIVABLE. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
